Stock Performance:

HDFC Life's shares showed some movement around May 1, 2025, with instances of slight decreases and increases in share price on May 2.

Later in May 2025, the stock reached new record highs following a period of consolidation. Technical analysis suggested potential for further upward movement.

The company set June 20, 2025, as the record date for a final dividend of Rs 2.10 per share for FY 2025, payable from July 21, 2025.

Financial Performance:

HDFC Life's Q1 FY26 results, released in July 2025, indicated strong year-on-year growth in both net profit and total premium income. The company saw improvements in new business margins and embedded value, contributing to an increased market share.

Regulatory Filings:

Audited financial results for FY 2025 were approved in April 2025. The company was contesting GST demand orders and income tax demands related to previous financial years.

Other Developments:

HDFC Life reported a high claim settlement ratio for FY 2025. Other developments included the allotment of shares under an ESOP scheme and a change in Company Secretary roles. Reports in August 2025 about a potential GST exemption for insurance policies also impacted insurance stocks, including HDFC Life.
